name: HD 165155
scenarioDescription:
The HD 165155 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 165155 is a star with 1.02 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.95 times its radius. It is located 207.01 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 11 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 165155 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 165155 system


HD 165155 b

HD 165155 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 165155 b is 919.0200000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 165155 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 165155, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
